CTASection.content: Hi, I'm Raúl! I like creating clean, responsive and functional web apps.

paragraph.text: I started studying web development with the help of The Odin Project.
Studied web fundamentals, learned how to set up a development environment using Ubuntu, how to work with Git with GitHub, then HTML and CSS.

paragraph.subtitle: A formal education
paragraph.text: I enrolled in Acámica’s Full Stack Web Development program in Buenos Aires, Argentina.
Improved my HTML and CSS skills, learned to use JavaScript, Node.js, Express.js, to work with relational and non-relational databases such as MySQL and MongoDB and studied agile methodology.
In 2020 I completed the Acámica program, I added features and made improvements to projects I’d started, started working as a freelance developer and also learned React.js on my own.

paragraph.subtitle: Thereafter
paragraph.text: Since they've allowed me to learn new technologies and to polish my programming skill set I've continued to study and to build personal projects.
I'm looking to join a proactive, innovative team filled with empathic people where I can continue growing both personally and professionally.

projects.name: Hacemos Tu Sociedad
projects.summary: Landing page built along the Estudio Mixto team. Responsible of implementing the previously designed visual elements and creating interaction states on the UI.

projects.name: Personal website
projects.summary: The website you're currently on! I designed and implemented the complete user interface and user experience.

projects.name: GifOS
projects.summary: Web app that allows the user to make their own GIFs, search for their favourite ones and get recommendations. I used the GIPHY API and the RecordRTC library.

projects.name: ClasesIN
projects.summary: Multi-page website for an e-learning platform. Responsible for developing the previously designed user interface and communicating directly with the UI designer to ease-up the development process.

footerSection.content: Made with React.js, TailwindCSS and a lot of ❤

notFound.content: I'm sorry, we were not able to find that page for you.
